title: Reloading page in some guides leads to the list of configuration properties being hidden
body:
### Describe the bug

In some guides, pressing CTRL+R (on Firefox) to reload the page leads to configuration properties no longer appearing in the page.

### Expected behavior

_No response_

### Actual behavior

_No response_

### How to Reproduce?

Go to https://quarkus.io/guides/hibernate-search-orm-elasticsearch#configuration-reference-coordination-outbox-polling
See how the list of properties is there
Reload the page (CTRL+R on Firefox)
See how the list of properties is now empty (though subsections are still there)

### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`

_No response_

### Output of `java -version`

_No response_

### Quarkus version or git rev

_No response_

### Build tool (ie. output of `mvnw --version` or `gradlew --version`)

_No response_

### Additional information

This might be related to the Javascript that hides content when we type text in the search box? I didn't use it, but maybe there's some misconfigured Javascript event handler in there...

Also, this page has configuration properties from two distinct extensions, so this might be related.
